Get Involved

Your support makes our work possible. Discover meaningful ways to contribute to building stronger, safer communities across Northumberland County.

Ways to Make a Difference

Whether you have time, resources, or expertise to share, there's a meaningful way for you to contribute to our community's wellbeing.

Volunteer

Share your time and skills to directly support community members

Donate

Contribute financially to sustain and expand our programs

Partner

Collaborate with us as an organization or business

Advocate

Help raise awareness and promote policy changes

Volunteer Opportunities

Join our team of dedicated volunteers making a direct impact in the lives of community members across Northumberland County.

Direct Service

  • Street Outreach: Support mobile outreach teams connecting with community members
  • Meal Programs: Help prepare and serve meals at shelter and community sites
  • Support Groups: Facilitate peer support and recovery programs
  • Transportation: Provide rides to appointments and services

Requirements: Background check, orientation training, and commitment to trauma-informed practices.

Administrative & Specialized

  • Data Entry: Help maintain client records and program statistics
  • Event Support: Assist with community events and fundraising activities
  • Professional Skills: Legal, accounting, marketing, or other professional expertise
  • Board Service: Join our board of directors or advisory committees

Flexible scheduling: Many opportunities available evenings and weekends to accommodate different schedules.

Apply to Volunteer

Support Our Work

Your financial contributions directly support programs that make a life-changing difference for the most vulnerable members of our community.

Monthly Giving

Provide consistent support that allows us to plan and sustain our programs year-round.

$25/month Emergency supplies for 10 people
$50/month One outreach visit weekly
$100/month Crisis intervention training
Start Monthly Giving

One-Time Gift

Make a one-time contribution to support immediate needs and program expansion.

$50 Emergency shelter for one night
$150 Health supplies for 50 people
$500 Mobile outreach for one week
Donate Now

In-Kind Donations

Donate goods and services that directly support our clients and operations.

  • • Winter clothing and blankets
  • • Non-perishable food items
  • • Personal hygiene products
  • • Office supplies and equipment
  • • Professional services
Donate Items

Tax Receipts Available

IHARC is a registered charity. All donations over $20 receive a tax receipt for income tax purposes. Charity Registration Number: 123456789RR0001

Partnership Opportunities

Collaborate with IHARC to amplify impact and create systemic change in addressing homelessness, mental health, and community safety.

Business Partnerships

  • Corporate Sponsorship: Support specific programs or events with financial contributions
  • Employee Volunteer Programs: Organize team volunteer opportunities for staff
  • Employment Partnerships: Create job opportunities for program participants
  • In-Kind Services: Provide goods, services, or expertise at reduced or no cost

Benefits: Corporate social responsibility recognition, team building opportunities, and community impact visibility.

Community & Government

  • Healthcare Partners: Collaborative care models and service integration
  • Housing Providers: Supportive housing and transitional programs
  • Government Agencies: Policy development and systematic change initiatives
  • Community Organizations: Joint programming and resource sharing

Focus Areas: System integration, policy advocacy, and coordinated community response approaches.

Explore Partnership Opportunities

Become an Advocate

Help us create lasting change by raising awareness, challenging stigma, and advocating for policies that support the most vulnerable in our community.

Share Our Story

Help raise awareness by sharing our impact and the importance of integrated support services.

Advocate for Change

Contact elected officials and support policies that address root causes of homelessness and addiction.

Challenge Stigma

Help create more compassionate communities by challenging misconceptions and promoting understanding.

Stay Connected

Join our advocacy network to receive updates on policy issues, action opportunities, and ways to make your voice heard.

Join Our Advocacy Network

Partner with us to improve safety and health across Northumberland.
